title: Mexico and Panama PPC and trade

content.description:
Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

Mexico and Panama are trading partners. Both countries have the same amount of resources and can produce tangerines and/or bananas. The table below shows the maximum number of units of tangerines or bananas that can be produced by each country. Assume constant opportunity costs in both countries.

Tangerines
 Bananas

Mexico
 <math alttext="50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

Panama
 <math alttext="50" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>
 <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

(a) Assume that prior to trade, Panama is producing <math alttext="15" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units of tangerines and <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> unit of bananas. What can you conclude about the use of resources in Panama? Explain using the production possibilities curve model.

(b) Which country has the comparative advantage in the production of tangerines? Explain using numbers.

(c) Now assume each country specializes in the production of the good in which it has a comparative advantage, and the terms of trade are <math alttext="4" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> units of tangerines for <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> unit of bananas. Will Mexico gain from trade? Explain.

(d) Suppose the maximum production of tangerines in Panama increases. How will this affect Panama’s opportunity cost of producing bananas? Explain.

(e) Assume Panama’s civilian working-age population is <math alttext="40" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>40</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> million, the labor force participation rate in Panama is <math alttext="50%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the unemployment rate is <math alttext="5%" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>5</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>. Calculate the number of employed people in Panama. Show your work.
content.question: Respond to all parts of the question.
